subject: Learning
title: Prussia Invents Compulsory Schooling
description: A 60-second lesson on Prussia Invents Compulsory Schooling.

hook.text: In 1763, Prussia forced every child to attend school. It was the first compulsory education law.

buildup.text: Frederick the Great wanted literate soldiers and obedient citizens. School was the tool.

discovery.text: The Prussian model standardized grades, timetables, curricula, and trained teachers for the first time.

twist.text: The goal was compliance, not creativity. Schools were designed to produce disciplined factory workers.

climax.text: America, Japan, and most nations copied this model. Your classroom today is essentially Prussian.

punchline.text: Modern schools were built for obedience. We still haven't fully redesigned them.

quiz.question: What was the primary goal of Prussia's compulsory schooling?
options: Producing literate, obedient citizens and soldiers
